text: #1276Many thanks to pivnizub!Bottle. Almost clear, very pale goldem body, medium white head. Aroma of citruses, malts. Taste is harsh, bitter, dry. Citruses, malts, touch of spices, but unfortunately old paper. Light to medium body, moderately carbonated. Not my style... papery tones are disturbing.

Bottle 0.33l from trade with pivnizub, many thanks, Guenther! Almost clear, pale gold colored. AROMA- lemon, spicy tones. FLAVOR- dry, harsh bitterness, citrusy, grapefruit, malt, but strong cardboard, too. Medium bodied. Not very good.
Geruch und Geschmack sehr hopfig mit einer deutlichen Bittere. Geschmack nach Gras, weißen Trauben, Blüten. Etwas wässrig vom Mundgefühl.
Goldig, opal. Geruch nach Zitrone und Kräuter. Im Geschmack bitter, leicht leer. Aber sehr erfrischend. Top! Mehr davon!
Pours a pale golden color, white head. Aroma is bready and grassy. Taste is malty with light peppery hops.

Clear yellow with little white head. Aroma is lychee, fresh citrussy hops. Taste is a little bitter and some slight fresh sourness. A bit of butter in the finish. Some shallow mouthfeel. Ok and amazing considering the low alcohol.
Bottle. Pale golden, low head. Citrus, oregano, rosemary. Light body, light sparkly. Quick finish, citrus, herbal retronasal. Nice!

(bottle) clear golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of sweatsocks, resin and horse manure, with lots of lemonde and a light hint of brown sugar. flavour is mostly chlorine and pale malts, with a touch of pears and a medium-bitter herbal-hoppy finish. light-bodied with average carbonation.
Bottle. Golden color with white head. Aroma is piney and herbal hops. Taste is the same, a bit light. Medium carbonation. Excellent Low ABV beer!

Heller erfrischender Antrunk, hopfig-herb mit deutlicher Grasigkeit, die zunehmend bittere Aromen entwickelt. Nuancen von Kräuter, dann wieder hopfiger, an der nun eher rabiaten und trockenen Bitterkeit wird der geringe Alkoholgehalt erstmals ersichtlich. Spritzig, mittellanger weicher Nachhall. Gut! 8/10/11/12/11/12

L:
-pours a clear straw golden with a medium to big,foamy,white head
-high carbonation visible
S:
-pineapple,nettle,zesty,pine,honey,br the nose
-elevated bitterniss
F:
-light body
-medium carbonation
O:
If only every low-alcohol Beer was like this...........

0.33 l bottle from Bierlager, best before April 2017. Clear, golden yelow with athin, rather fluffy, slowly diminishing, white head. Sweetish, fruity-grassy and floral aroma of pineapple, fresh grass, lychee and caramel. Slightly bitter, a bit sweet, fruity-grassy and a bit floral taste of caramel, straw, pineapple, lychee and grains, followed by a short, moderately bitter, quite grassy and rather dry finish. Almost medium-bodied, slightly effervescent mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Really nice for that abv (India Session Lager?)!

Für ein Leichtgewicht bietet dieses hier aber das volle Programm, was mich dann doch überrascht hat. Wunderbar eingehopft mit einer schön fruchtigen, zitronigen Tendenz, dabei jedoch im Abgang sogar leicht vanilin und blumig. Sehr ausgewogen, sehr stimmig eingebraut. Wunderbar.

33cl bottle. Pours clear pale golden colour with a mid-sized most good lasting white head. Aroma of aromatic floral bitter hops, dry. Taste of dry floral hops, very fresh, thin body, very good, delicious!

bottle, díky pane doktore! Pale golden yellow, mid-sized white head, lovely aroma of fresh hops. Light-bodied, shy but good malty background. Lovely aromatic hops that add fruity flavours. A truly good beer for the summer!

0,33 l bottle purchased at Bierzwerg bottle shop, Greven. Clear dark golden in the glass with an one finger foamy head. Surprisingly intensive floral hopy on the nose. Taste starts with a short floral hop sequence, followed by a more grainy and pale malt part, some citrus, with a floweresque hopy background. Amazingly complex for such a low alcohol beer. Little bit soapy with present bitterness to the end. Interesting.

(bottle, 33cl) Clear, pale golden colour with a blond medium-sized foamy head. Fresh hoppy aroma with fruity and delicately herbal accents, including notes of citrus, peaches and tropical hints, backed by a mildly grainy malty touch. Slightly bitter flavour, light bodied with a moderate carbonation. Discreetly grainy malty base with present fruity and slightly herbal hoppy notes tuning in and lingering into mildly hop bitter and slim malty finish. The lack of malty body is not eminent if you are aware of having a low alcoholic beer. 16.V.16

UPDATED: MAY 19, 2016 From the bottle poured into Spiegelau IPA Glass. Pours clear golden with quickly vanishing white head. Nose is herbal citric hops. Taste is herbal too middle part is a bit watery most likely given to the 2,6% ABV. Finish is Pilsener like herbal astringent finish but only a short one. Given its a light Summer beer I tend to like it for its refreshing herbal style...

330ml bottle. Clear, yellow-ish golden colour with average, creamy, fairly lasting, moderately lacing, white head. Grassy, citrusy and tropical fruity, hoppy aroma, notes of fresh hay, passion fruit, mango. Taste is bitter hoppy, grassy, slightly chalky, minimally citrusy, minimally soapy, diluted remnants of passion fruit, weak pale malty basis, slightly watery. Exhibits the weakness well known from Session IPAs: A lack of malt support to reproduce the hop flavours in taste.

Sehr florale frische Note. Das Bier startet sehr süffig & hopfenaromatisch. Rund und weich, sehr floral & süffig. Mild grasig mit toller Hopfennote im Nachgeschmack. Tolle Citrus-Töne. Süffig und toll! Der geringe ABV fällt kaum auf.

Bottle:(Festival Dortmunder Bierkultur):Golden, almost clear, medium-sized loose and stable white head; distinctive dryish peachy and grapefruity nose, mild traces of pale malt underneath;distinctive dry bitter flavour, very faint traces of a malty sweetness, light bodied and a bit tart; lingering, dry grapefruity finish. Good, bur a bit thin for my liking
